citations.narrative:
One wire mesh puppy enclosure had a small section of wire mesh floor that is not connected to the side wire creating a
gap in the floor. This needs to be addressed to keep the enclosure in good repair for the safety of the puppies.
Correct by: Feb 14, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The inside enclosure runs are not being spot cleaned daily. The facility has been using sawdust on in the inside enclosure
floors and is removing the feces and sawdust every three days. Fecal waste must be removed from primary enclosures
daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and for their welfare.
Correct by: Feb 8, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Housekeeping for the facility needs to be addressed. There are tools and other miscellaneous items (magic eraser
sponge) being stored directly on top of wire mesh puppy enclosures. One puppy was playing with the sponge which could
cause harm if potentially ingested. The table along the wall had food items and dental chews stored next to various
husbandry supplies and general clutter. This clutter and various supplies can promote an area for pests to thrive and
needs to be cleaned. Areas in the kennel must be kept clean to facilitate and promote hood housekeeping practices.
Correct by: Feb 8, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
One wire mesh puppy enclosure had a small section of wire mesh floor that is not connected to the side wire creating a 
gap in the floor. This needs to be addressed to keep the enclosure in good repair for the safety of the puppies.  
Correct by: Feb 14, 2024 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The inside enclosure runs are not being spot cleaned daily. The facility has been using sawdust on in the inside enclosure 
floors and is removing the feces and sawdust every three days. Fecal waste must be removed from primary enclosures 
daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and for their welfare.  
Correct by: Feb 8, 2024 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Housekeeping for the facility needs to be addressed. There are tools and other miscellaneous items (magic eraser 
sponge) being stored directly on top of wire mesh puppy enclosures. One puppy was playing with the sponge which could 
cause harm if potentially ingested. The table along the wall had food items and dental chews stored next to various 
husbandry supplies and general clutter. This clutter and various supplies can promote an area for pests to thrive and 
needs to be cleaned. Areas in the kennel must be kept clean to facilitate and promote hood housekeeping practices.  
Correct by: Feb 8, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
